channel.title: [PHP] Parse Error? Wtf?
channel.description:
I get this error:
Parse error: parse error, unexpected '@' in /homepages/44/d194501319/htdocs/wsb4407329501/Login/register.php on line 48
when I try to compile my register script.
This is the code that I'm using on line 48:
[code]$youremail = ‘register@zezumascape.com’;[/code]
Any help? I don't know why it would have an error with the @ symbol, unless theres a code to replace it.
EDIT: osht, I fixed it, but now I get this:
[code]Parse error: parse error, unexpected T_STRING in /homepages/44/d194501319/htdocs/wsb4407329501/Login/login.php on line 19[/code]
I have no clue what that is, and I'm using the login tutorual from http://swish-db.com/tutorials/view.php/tid/601 . Any more help? lol

item.title: [PHP] Parse Error? Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

He said he fixed it that it was the weird quotes he used.

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP] Parse Error? Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

the unexpected t_string i get for 2 reasons

  1. i click a short cut key but hit it wrong or something along those lines. ex. enter a v instead of paste because i pressed control and let go too fast

  2. i just hit a key without knowing it

  3. forget a semicolon

check all those things

Read full topic

Me thinks you forgot a semicolon( somewhere. xD

item.title: [PHP] Parse Error? Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“welshy, post:3, topic:122190”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=171794.msg1588337#msg1588337 date=1184218442]
I don’t think you can use those quotes for strings, you should be using ’ or ". I don’t even have the ones you used on my keyboard…
[/quote] ’ that turns out like that this ' see hes using the right quotation marks[/quote]No he’s not, he’s using `.

RXVL, can you please post line 17 through 21 in login.php

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP] Parse Error? Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Yeah I think Mopman is right. Those quotation marks will most likely make the code error out.

Just do a quick find for this ‘ and ’ and convert it to this ’

item.title: [PHP] Parse Error? Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

I get this error:

Parse error: parse error, unexpected ‘@’ in /homepages/44/d194501319/htdocs/wsb4407329501/Login/register.php on line 48

when I try to compile my register script.

This is the code that I’m using on line 48:

$youremail = ‘register@zezumascape.com’;

Any help? I don’t know why it would have an error with the @ symbol, unless theres a code to replace it.

EDIT: osht, I fixed it, but now I get this:

Parse error: parse error, unexpected T_STRING in /homepages/44/d194501319/htdocs/wsb4407329501/Login/login.php on line 19

I have no clue what that is, and I’m using the login tutorual from http://swish-db.com/tutorials/view.php/tid/601 . Any more help? lol

Read full topic
